name: Instant Pot® BBQ Chicken Thighs
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Fall-off-the-bone tender chicken thighs made in a multi-functional pressure cooker for those days when grilling is out of the question.
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function
Add chicken thighs and cook until browned, about 3 minutes on each side
Pour chicken broth into the pot
Cook and scrape up brown bits with a wooden spoon to deglaze the pot, about 1 minute
Add celery, 1/2 cup barbecue sauce, and browned chicken thighs to the pot
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to low
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Transfer chicken to a baking sheet and baste with remaining 1/2 cup barbecue sauce
Broil for 5 minutes or until crisp
